Short description: Based on 2000 spring data from the C2Vsim fine grid model

Simulation based on C2Vsim average flow conditions. Each basin has been averaged on a different period

User friendly name: Public Supply Wells and Irrigation Wells
Short description: Computes nitrate-N at large production wells
Long description: This scenario predicts the nitrate-N outcome at all large production wells - irrigation wells and public supply wells.  These wells are explicitly represented in the underlying flow model as pumping wells. Their specific location is precise to the township-section (1 square mile) and randomized within the section. The well pumping rate
url: screen length and depth corresponds to reported values
column9: randomized values that are typical for wells in the corresponding groundwater sub-basin.

Long description: This scenario predicts the nitrate-N outcome at all domestic wells known to California DWR. These wells are assumed to have very low pumping rates. Their specific location is precise to the township-section (1 square mile) and randomized within the section. The well screen length and depth corresponds to reported values
column8: randomized values that are typical for wells in the corresponding groundwater sub-basin.

User friendly name: Virtual Shallow Monitoring Well Network Grid
Short description: Computes nitrate-N in a virtual monitoring well network
Long description: This scenario predicts the nitrate-N outcome at hypothetical monitoring wells in the shallow part of the aquifer. Monitoring wells are placed every 165 ft and "measure" the average nitrate-N concentration across the first 200 ft below the water table.
